translation.en: In the afternoon, the rat man came to the petrol station.
translation.ko: 쥐잡이 사내가 주유소에 도착한 것은 오후였다

translation.en: He sidled up the driveway with a soft, stealthy gait.
translation.ko: 조용조용 발소리 하나 없이 진입로로 들어섰다

translation.en: His feet made no noise at all on the gravel.
translation.ko: 자갈을 밟는데도 소리가 전혀 안 났다

translation.en: He had an army knapsack slung over one shoulder.
He wore an old-fashioned corduroy jacket with large pockets.
translation.ko: 커다란 주머니가 달린 구식 코듀로이 재킷에

translation.en: Corduroy trousers were tied around the knees with lengths of white string.
translation.ko: 코듀로이 바지는 무릎 부분이 흰색 끈으로 동여매져 있었다

translation.en: -Hello? -Yes?
Rodent operative.
His small, dark eyes moved swiftly over the premises.
translation.ko: 작고 까만 눈동자를 굴려 주변을 둘러보았다

translation.en: -The rat man? -That's me.
He was lean, leathery, a sharp face,
translation.ko: 탄탄한 몸, 거친 피부, 긴 얼굴

translation.en: two long, sulfur-yellow teeth protruding from the upper jaw over the lower lip.
translation.ko: 누런 앞니 두 개가 길게 뻗어 아랫입술을 덮었다

translation.en: His ears were round and thin, set near the back of his head.
translation.ko: 얇고 둥근 귀는 거의 뒤통수까지 뻗어 있었다

translation.en: The eyes were almost black,
but when they looked at you, there was a flash of yellow in them.
translation.ko: 사람을 볼 때면 안쪽엔 노란 기가 돌았다

translation.en: -You've come quick. -Special orders from the Health Office.
translation.ko: - 빨리 오셨네요 - 보건국 특별 지시가 있어서요

translation.en: And now you're going to catch all the rats?
-Yeah. -How?
Yes. How?
Depends what rats, where they is. Different methods for different rats.
translation.ko: 쥐의 종류와 위치에 따라 방법은 여러 가지입니다

translation.en: -Trap them, I suppose. -What?
-Trap 'em. -Trap 'em?
The rat man snorted.
Won't catch 'em that way. Rats ain't rabbits.
translation.ko: 그렇겐 못 잡아요 쥐가 토끼도 아니고

translation.en: He held his face up high,
sniffing the air with a nose that twitched perceptibly from side to side.
Rats is clever. You wanna catch 'em, you gotta know 'em.
You gotta know rats on this job.
translation.ko: 이 일을 하려면 쥐를 잘 알아야 해요

translation.en: You know what they do? They watch you.
Whole time you're preparin' how to exterminate 'em, they're watchin' you.
translation.ko: 쥐를 박멸하려고 준비하는 내내 사람을 지켜보죠

translation.en: This ain't a sewer job, is it?
No, it's not a sewer job.
-Tricky things, sewer jobs. -I shouldn't think so.
translation.ko: - 하수관 작업은 까다롭죠 - 안 그럴 것 같은데요

translation.en: You shouldn't, should you? I'd like to see you do a sewer job.
Just exactly how'd you set about it, I'd like to know.
Poison them, I suppose.
And where exactly would you put the poison?
Down the sewer?
The rat man sparkled, triumphant.
Yeah, I knew it. "Down the sewer."
Know what'd happen? Get washed away completely.
translation.ko: 그럼 어떻게 될까요? 싹 쓸려 내려갑니다

translation.en: All your poison. Sewer's like a river.
translation.ko: 약이 싹 사라져요 하수관은 강 같거든요

translation.en: All right. Well, what would you do, Mr. Rat Man? On a sewer job?
The rat man advanced a step closer.
His voice became secretive and confidential,
the voice of a man divulging professional secrets.
translation.ko: 대단한 영업 비밀이라도 알려주는 듯 말했다

translation.en: You works on the understandin' a rat is a gnawin' animal, see?
Anythin' you give 'em, they gnaws on it.
So you got a sewer job on your hands. What d'you do?
translation.ko: 하수구의 쥐를 잡을 땐 어떻게 해야 하느냐?

translation.en: His voice had the soft, throaty sound of a croaking frog,
translation.ko: 그의 목소리는 꾸룩대는 개구리 소리 같았고

translation.en: and he seemed to speak all his words with a wet-lipped relish,
translation.ko: 입에 침이 고이기라도 한 듯 한 마디 한 마디를 하는 모습이

translation.en: as if they tasted good on the tongue.
You go down the sewer and you take along some ordinary brown paper bags
filled with plaster of paris powder. Nothin' else.
translation.ko: 봉투에는 오로지 석고 가루만 들어 있죠

translation.en: Then you suspend 'em from the roof of the sewer
so they hangs down not quite touchin' the water.
translation.ko: 물에 닿지 않을 정도로 드리워야 해요

translation.en: Just high enough so a rat can reach 'em.
Claud was listening, rapt.
Old rat comes swimmin' along the sewer, sees the bag. He stops.
translation.ko: 헤엄쳐 오던 늙은 쥐 한 마리가 봉투를 보고 멈춥니다

translation.en: [sniffs] Takes a sniff at it. It don't smell so bad.
-What's he do? -He gnaws it.
That's it! He starts gnawin' at the bag, and the bag breaks,
and the old rat gets a mouthful of powder for his pains.
translation.ko: 쥐는 노력의 대가로 입안 가득 석고 가루를 얻겠죠

translation.en: Well?
Well, that does him.
-That kills him? -Stone dead.
-Plaster of paris… -It swells when you wet it.
Gets into the rat's tubes and swells right up
and kills him quicker than anythin' in the world.
That's where you got to know rats.
translation.ko: 이래서 쥐에 대해 잘 알아야 한다니까요

translation.en: His face glowed with a shifty pride.
He rubbed his stringy fingers together, holding the hands up close to his face.
translation.ko: 지저분한 두 손을 모으더니 얼굴 가까이 가져갔다

translation.en: Now, where's them rats?
The word "rats" came out with a rich, fruity sound
as if he were gargling with melted butter.
In the hayrick across the road.
-Not inside? -Only in the hayrick. Nowhere else.
I'll wager they're inside too, gettin' in your food, spreadin' disease.
translation.ko: 실내에도 있을 겁니다 음식을 깔짝대며 병을 퍼뜨리겠죠

translation.en: -Got any sickness here? -He looked pointedly at me, then at Claud.
translation.ko: - 병이 돌진 않습니까? - 나와 클로드를 차례로 쳐다봤다

translation.en: -Everyone's well. -Quite sure?
-Quite sure. -You never know.
He'd taken upon himself the mantle of a public health officer,
disappointed we were not suffering from bubonic plague.
translation.ko: 림프절 페스트가 돌지 않는다는 말에 실망했다

translation.en: Nevertheless, the rats are in the hayrick. How will you remove them?
translation.ko: 어쨌든 건초더미에 쥐들이 있는데 어떻게 없앨 겁니까?

translation.en: The rat man grinned a crafty, toothy grin.
translation.ko: 사내는 이를 드러내며 교활한 웃음을 짓더니

translation.en: He reached into his knapsack and withdrew a large tin,
weighing it up and down in his hands as he spoke.
Poison. Special poison. Deadly poison.
They'd put you inside if they caught you with even a spoonful of this.
translation.ko: 아주 조금만 갖고 있다가 걸려도 6개월은 감옥에서 썩을 겁니다

translation.en: There's enough here to kill a million men.
translation.ko: 이 정도 양이면 백만 명을 죽일 수 있어요

translation.en: -Want to see? -Yes, please.
He took a penny and prized open the lid.
translation.ko: 사내는 동전을 꺼내 지렛대 삼아 뚜껑을 열었다

translation.en: There it is.
He spoke almost lovingly of the stuff and held it forward for Claud.
translation.ko: 사랑스럽다는 듯 깡통을 들어 클로드에게 보여줬다

translation.en: [Claud] Corn or barley, is it?
Oats. Oats soaked in deadly poison.
You take just one grain in your mouth and you're a goner in three minutes.
translation.ko: 한 알만 입에 넣어도 3분 안에 저세상행이죠

translation.en: Never out of me sight, this tin.
[editor] He caressed the tin and shook it…
translation.ko: 그가 통을 소중히 감싸 쥐고 살짝 흔들자

translation.en: -[rat man mimics rattle] -…so the oat grains rustled softly inside.
But your rats don't get this today. They wouldn't have it, anyway.
translation.ko: 하지만 오늘은 안 줄 겁니다 줘 봤자 안 먹을 거거든요

translation.en: That's where you got to know rats. Rats is suspicious. Terrible suspicious.
translation.ko: 그게 쥐의 습성이죠 극도로 의심이 많아요

translation.en: So today they get some nice, clean, tasty oats
translation.ko: 오늘은 깨끗하고 맛있는 귀리를 줄 겁니다

translation.en: as will do 'em no harm in the world.
translation.ko: 어떤 해도 끼치지 않겠죠 기껏해야 살찌는 정도려나

translation.en: Fatten 'em up, that's all. And tomorrow, the same again.
translation.ko: 어떤 해도 끼치지 않겠죠 기껏해야 살찌는 정도려나 내일도 똑같이 할 겁니다 그다음 날도, 또 다음 날도

translation.en: And the day after that, and the day after that.
translation.ko: 내일도 똑같이 할 겁니다 그다음 날도, 또 다음 날도

translation.en: And it'll taste so good, all the rats in the district will be comin' along soon enough.
translation.ko: 귀리 맛이 좋다고 소문나서 곧 온 동네 쥐들이 모여들겠죠

translation.en: Very clever.
You got to be clever on this job, cleverer than a rat.
translation.ko: 이 일을 하려면 쥐보다 영리해야 합니다

translation.en: And that's saying something.
"You've almost got to be a rat yourself."
translation.ko: '아예 쥐가 돼야겠네요' 생각할 틈도 없이 그냥 튀어나와 버렸다

translation.en: It slipped out before I could stop myself.
translation.ko: 생각할 틈도 없이 그냥 튀어나와 버렸다

translation.en: I couldn't help it, I was looking at him at the time.
translation.ko: 사내를 보고 있자니 그 말을 참을 수가 없었다

translation.en: The effect it had on him was surprising.
-That's it! -…he cried.
Now you got it, you really said somethin'.
A good ratter's gotta be more like a rat than anythin' else.
translation.ko: 훌륭한 쥐 박멸 전문가라면 누구보다 쥐와 닮아야 하고

translation.en: Cleverer even than a rat, and that is not an easy thing to be, let me tell you.
translation.ko: 쥐보다 영리해야 하는데 그게 쉬운 일이 아니에요

translation.en: Well, let's get on with it.
Lady Leonora Benson's asking for me urgent up at the manor.
translation.ko: 레이디 리어노라 벤슨이 저택에 빨리 와달라고 해서요

translation.en: She's got rats too?
Everybody's got rats.
The rat man ambled off down the driveway.
The way he walked was so like a rat, it made you wonder.
That slow, almost delicate, ambling walk with a lot of give at the knees
translation.ko: 무릎의 탄성을 이용한 느긋하면서 섬세한 걸음

translation.en: and no sound at all from his footsteps on the gravel.
translation.ko: 자갈을 밟는데 소리 한번 나지 않았다

translation.en: He hopped over the gate, and walked quickly 'round the hayrick,
translation.ko: 그는 울타리를 훌쩍 뛰어넘더니 건초더미 주위를 빠르게 돌며 귀리 몇 줌을 땅에 뿌렸다

translation.en: scattering handfuls of oats onto the ground.
translation.ko: 건초더미 주위를 빠르게 돌며 귀리 몇 줌을 땅에 뿌렸다

translation.en: The next day he returned and repeated the procedure.
translation.ko: 다음 날 다시 와서 같은 작업을 반복했다

translation.en: The day after that he came again, and the day after that,
translation.ko: 그다음 날에도 왔고 또 그다음 날에도 왔다

translation.en: and finally, on the fourth day, he put down the poisoned oats.
translation.ko: 그리고 드디어 나흘째에 약에 적신 귀리가 등장했다

translation.en: But he didn't scatter these. Instead, he placed them in little piles
translation.ko: 그런데 이번엔 뿌리지 않고 건초더미 주위 몇 군데에 한 무더기씩 두었다

translation.en: at each corner of the hayrick.
translation.ko: 건초더미 주위 몇 군데에 한 무더기씩 두었다

translation.en: -You got a dog? -[Claud] Yes.
Well, if you want him to die a horrible, twisting death, let him in that gate.
translation.ko: 개가 끔찍하게 죽길 바라지 않으면 울타리 못 넘어오게 하세요

translation.en: The next day he came to collect the dead.
Get me an old sack. I'm gonna need one to put 'em in.
translation.ko: 죽은 쥐 좀 넣게 낡은 자루 하나 주십쇼

translation.en: He was puffed up and important now, the black eyes gleaming with pride.
translation.ko: 득의양양한 태도로 검은 눈동자엔 자신감이 가득했다

translation.en: He was about to display the results of his catch to the audience.
translation.ko: 이제 곧 대단한 성과를 선보일 참인 것이다

translation.en: Claud fetched a sack and we walked across the road.
translation.ko: 클로드가 자루를 가져왔고 다 같이 길 건너편으로 갔다

translation.en: The rat man prowled around the hayrick,
bending over to inspect one of his piles of poison.
translation.ko: 몸을 숙여 독약 귀리 무더기를 들여다보았다

translation.en: -Something wrong here. -…he muttered.
His voice was soft and angry.
He ambled over to another pile and got down to examine it closely.
translation.ko: 다른 귀리 무더기 쪽으로 가더니 엎드려서 자세히 들여다봤다

translation.en: -Something wrong here. -[Claud] What's the matter?
He didn't answer, but it was clear the rats hadn't touched his bait.
translation.ko: 대답은 없었지만 쥐들이 미끼를 건드리지 않은 건 분명해 보였다

translation.en: "These are very clever rats here," I said.
The rat man was annoyed
translation.ko: 그는 내 말에 짜증이 났고 얼굴과 코에 감정이 드러났으며

translation.en: and showed it on his face and nose and by the way the two yellow teeth
translation.ko: 그는 내 말에 짜증이 났고 얼굴과 코에 감정이 드러났으며 누런 앞니 두 개는 아랫입술을 파고들 듯했다

translation.en: were pressing into his lower lip.
translation.ko: 누런 앞니 두 개는 아랫입술을 파고들 듯했다

translation.en: -Don't give me that crap. -…he said, looking at me.
translation.ko: - 헛소리하지 마쇼 - 그가 날 보며 말했다

translation.en: Nothing's wrong with these rats, somebody's feedin' 'em.
translation.ko: 쥐가 문제가 아니라 어디서 뭘 먹고 온 겁니다

translation.en: They got somethin' juicy to eat somewhere, plenty of it.
No rats in the world will turn down oats unless their bellies is full to burstin'.
translation.ko: 배가 터질 듯 부르지 않고서야 귀리를 마다할 쥐는 없어요

translation.en: The rat man turned away, sullen.
He knelt down again scooping up the poisoned oats with a small shovel,
translation.ko: 무릎을 꿇고 앉아 모종삽으로 독약 귀리를 푸더니

translation.en: tipping it carefully back into a tin.
When he had finished, all three of us walked back across the road.
translation.ko: 작업이 끝난 후, 우리 셋은 다시 길을 건너 돌아왔다

translation.en: The rat man stood by the petrol-pump,
a rather sorry, humble rat man now
whose face was beginning to take on a brooding aspect.
He had withdrawn into himself over his failure, the eyes veiled and wicked,
translation.ko: 실패감에 위축된 듯했고 속 모를 눈동자는 음산했다

translation.en: the little tongue darting out to one side of the two yellow teeth.
translation.ko: 누런 앞니 한쪽 옆으로 혀를 살짝 내밀었다

translation.en: He looked up at me, a surreptitious glance, then over at Claud.
translation.ko: 음침한 눈길로 나를 한 번 보고 클로드를 돌아보았다

translation.en: His nose-end twitched, sniffing the air.
He raised himself up and down on his toes, swaying gently,
translation.ko: 발뒤꿈치를 들었다 놨다 하며 천천히 몸을 흔들더니

translation.en: and in a soft voice, soft and secretive, he said…
You want to see something?
He was trying to retrieve his reputation.
-What? -You want to see something amazing?
He put his right hand into the poacher's pocket of his jacket
translation.ko: 오른손을 재킷의 건빵 주머니 깊숙이 집어넣더니

translation.en: and brought out a large, live rat clasped tight between his fingers.
translation.ko: 살아 있는 커다란 쥐를 꺼냈는데 두 손가락으로 꽉 움켜쥔 채였다

translation.en: Good God!
[chuckles] That's it. You see?
He was crouching slightly and craning his neck forward
translation.ko: 몸을 움츠리고 목을 길게 뺀 채 능글맞은 얼굴로 우릴 보며

translation.en: and leering at us and holding this enormous brown rat,
translation.ko: 몸을 움츠리고 목을 길게 뺀 채 능글맞은 얼굴로 우릴 보며 커다란 갈색 쥐를 들고 있는데

translation.en: one finger and thumb making a tight circle around its neck,
translation.ko: 엄지와 검지로 원을 만들듯 쥐의 목을 잡고

translation.en: clamping its head so it couldn't turn and bite.
translation.ko: 고개 돌려 물지 못하게 단단히 틀어쥐었다

translation.en: Do you go around with rats in your pockets?
Always a rat or two about me somewhere.
translation.ko: 쥐 한두 마리쯤은 늘 지니고 다니지요

translation.en: He put his free hand into the other pocket and produced a small, white…
translation.ko: 다른 손을 다른 주머니에 넣더니 꺼내 든 것은 작고 하얀…

translation.en: -Is that a ferret? -The rat man snickered, hissing.
The ferret seemed to know him and stayed still.
translation.ko: 페럿은 주인을 알아보는 듯 손안에서 얌전히 있었다

translation.en: Nothing will kill a rat quicker than a ferret.
He held the two animals close in front of him
translation.ko: 그리고는 두 짐승 사이의 거리를 좁혔고

translation.en: so the ferret's nose came within six inches of the rat's face.
translation.ko: 이제 페럿의 코와 쥐의 얼굴은 15cm밖에 떨어지지 않았다

translation.en: The pink beady eyes of the ferret stared at the rat.
The rat struggled, trying to edge away from the killer.
-Now. -…he said.
Watch.
[editor] His khaki shirt was open at the neck,
translation.ko: 카키색 셔츠의 단추가 두어 개 풀려 있었는데

translation.en: and he lifted the rat and slipped it down inside, next to his skin.
His belt prevented the rat from going lower than his waist.
translation.ko: 벨트 때문에 쥐는 허리 아래로 내려갈 수 없었다

translation.en: He slipped the ferret in next.
Immediately, there was a great commotion inside the shirt.
It appeared the rat was running around his body, chased by the ferret.
translation.ko: 쥐가 페럿을 피하려고 사내의 몸을 둘러 달리는 듯했다

translation.en: Six or seven times they went around, the small bulge chasing the larger one,
translation.ko: 6, 7바퀴를 도는 동안 작은 덩어리와 큰 덩어리 사이가

translation.en: gaining on it slightly each circuit, drawing closer and closer
until at last the two bulges seemed to come together,
translation.ko: 결국 두 덩어리가 하나가 되는 듯 보였고

translation.en: and there was a scuffle and a series of shrill shrieks.
Throughout this performance, the rat man stood absolutely still,
translation.ko: 공연이 진행되는 동안 사내는 꼼짝도 하지 않았다

translation.en: legs apart, arms hanging loosely,
translation.ko: 두 다리를 벌리고 두 팔은 살짝 늘어뜨린 채

translation.en: dark eyes resting calmly on Claud's frozen face.
translation.ko: 클로드의 얼어붙은 얼굴을 까만 눈동자로 주시했다

translation.en: Finally, he took his hand and reached down into his shirt
and pulled out the ferret.
With the other, he took out the dead rat.
There were traces of blood around the white muzzle of the ferret.
translation.ko: 페럿의 하얀 주둥이엔 피가 묻어 있었다

translation.en: "Not sure I liked that very much," I said.
You never seen nothin' like it before, I'll bet you that.
translation.ko: 이런 광경은 전에 본 적 없겠죠

translation.en: Can't say I have.
You'll get a nasty nip in the guts one of these days.
translation.ko: 계속 그러다가는 결국 배를 물릴 겁니다

translation.en: …Claud told him, but was intrigued, and the rat man was becoming cocky again.
translation.ko: 하지만 클로드는 분명 흥미로워했고 사내는 다시 우쭐해졌다

translation.en: You want to see something far more amazing?
Something you'd never believe unless you're seeing it with your own eyes?
translation.ko: 직접 보지 않고는 절대 못 믿을 모습을요

translation.en: I glanced at Claud more than slightly apprehensive.
translation.ko: 나는 꽤나 걱정이 돼서 클로드를 흘끗 봤다

translation.en: Yes.
The rat man slipped the dead rat into one pocket and the ferret into the other.
translation.ko: 사내는 죽은 쥐를 한쪽 주머니에 페럿을 다른 주머니에 넣었다

translation.en: Then he reached into his knapsack and produced a second live rat.
translation.ko: 그러더니 가방을 뒤져 두 번째 살아 있는 쥐를 꺼냈다

translation.en: Holy Christ!
Always got one or two rats about me somewhere.
You got to know rats on this job,
translation.ko: 이 일을 하려면 쥐를 잘 알아야 하고

translation.en: and if you wanna know 'em you gotta have 'em around.
This is a sewer rat, this one. An old sewer rat, clever as buggery.
translation.ko: 이놈은 늙은 시궁쥐인데 지독하게 영리한 놈입니다

translation.en: See him watchin' me all the time, wonderin' what I'm gonna do next?
translation.ko: 이번엔 뭘 하려나, 하며 날 바라보곤 하지요

translation.en: -See him? -Most unpleasant.
"What will you do?"
I had a feeling I'd like this demonstration less than the last one.
translation.ko: 좀 전의 공연보다 더 별로일 듯한 느낌이 들었다

translation.en: -Fetch me a piece of string. -Claud fetched a piece of string.
translation.ko: - 끈 하나만 주시지요 - 클로드가 끈을 하나 줬고

translation.en: The rat man looped it around the rat's hind leg.
The rat struggled, but the rat man held it tight.
translation.ko: 쥐가 발버둥쳤지만 손아귀에서 꼼짝 못 했다

translation.en: Now, you got a table inside?
"We don't want the rat inside," I said.
Well, I need a table. Or somethin' flat, anyway.
We walked over to the petrol-pump and he put the sewer rat on top.
translation.ko: 우린 주유기 쪽으로 갔고 사내는 시궁쥐를 그 위에 올려놨다

translation.en: He attached the string to a post so the rat was now tethered.
translation.ko: 그리고 쥐가 도망 못 가도록 기둥에 줄을 묶었다

translation.en: At first, it crouched, unmoving and suspicious,
translation.ko: 쥐는 웅크린 채 미동도 않고 경계했다

translation.en: a big-bodied gray rat with bright black eyes
translation.ko: 커다란 회색 쥐는 검은 눈동자를 빛냈고

translation.en: and a scaly tail that lay in a long curl on the metal surface.
translation.ko: 비늘로 덮인 긴 꼬리는 철제 주유기 위에 늘어져 있었다

translation.en: It was looking away, but watching him sideways
translation.ko: 쥐는 사내에게서 눈을 거뒀지만 어쩌려는지 살피듯 곁눈질로 쳐다보았다

translation.en: to see what he was going to do.
The rat man stepped back a few paces, and immediately the rat relaxed.
translation.ko: 사내가 몇 발짝 물러서자 쥐는 곧장 긴장을 풀었다

translation.en: It sat up on its haunches and began to lick the gray fur on its chest.
translation.ko: 엉덩이를 바닥에 대고 앉더니 가슴의 회색 털을 핥기 시작했다

translation.en: Then it scratched its muzzle with both front paws.
It seemed quite unconcerned about the other men standing nearby.
translation.ko: 옆에 있는 다른 사람들에겐 신경도 쓰지 않는 듯했다

translation.en: -How about a little bet? -[editor] …the rat man said.
"No, thank you." I said.
-[rat man] It's more fun if you bet. -[Claud] What do you want to bet on?
translation.ko: - 내기하면 더 재밌을 텐데요 - 무슨 내기를 하게요?

translation.en: [rat man] I can kill that rat without using my hands.
translation.ko: 손을 쓰지 않고 저 쥐를 죽여보겠습니다

translation.en: I'll put 'em in my pockets and not use 'em.
[editor] It was apparent the rat man was out to earn some money.
I looked at the rat that was to be killed and began to feel sick,
translation.ko: 곧 죽을 쥐를 보니 속이 울렁거렸다

translation.en: not because it was going to be killed,
but because it was to be killed in a special way,
translation.ko: 특별한 방식으로 죽을 거라는 사실 때문이었다

translation.en: with a considerable degree of enthusiasm.
-No arms? -No arms, no legs, no hands neither.
translation.ko: - 팔은요 - 팔, 다리, 손, 다 안 써요

translation.en: -You'll sit on it. -No squashing.
-Let's see it. -Bet me a quid first.
Don't be bloody daft. Why should we?
-What'll you bet? -Zero. Nothing.
All right. Then it's a no-go.
-He made as if to untie the string. -I'll bet a shilling.
translation.ko: - 사내는 끈을 푸는 시늉을 했다 - 1실링 걸죠

translation.en: The sick sensation in my stomach was increasing.
But there was an awful magnetism about this business.
translation.ko: 이 모든 상황엔 묘하게 자석 같은 힘이 있었고

translation.en: I found myself unable to walk away or even move.
translation.ko: 나는 그 자리를 뜨긴커녕 움직일 수도 없었다

translation.en: -You too? -No.
Want me to do this for a shilling?
-I don't want you to do it. -Where's the money?
Claud put a shilling on the petrol-pump.
The rat man laid two sixpences beside Claud's money.
translation.ko: 사내는 클로드의 돈 옆에 6펜스 동전 두 개를 놓았다

translation.en: Bet's on.
Claud and I stepped back.
translation.ko: 클로드와 나는 물러섰고 사내는 앞으로 다가섰다

translation.en: The rat man stepped forward, put his hands in his pockets
translation.ko: 클로드와 나는 물러섰고 사내는 앞으로 다가섰다 두 손을 주머니에 넣더니 상체를 쥐 쪽으로 기울였다

translation.en: and inclined his body from the waist toward the rat.
translation.ko: 두 손을 주머니에 넣더니 상체를 쥐 쪽으로 기울였다

translation.en: The rat was crouching, alarmed.
It seemed it was preparing to spring at the rat man,
but then it began to reverse away,
dragging its body backwards with crouching steps
translation.ko: 웅크린 채 천천히 뒤로 물러나다 보니

translation.en: until the string tautened on its hind leg.
The rat man leaned further towards the rat,
translation.ko: 사내는 쥐 쪽으로 몸을 더 기울였다

translation.en: following it back and forth with his eyes. Suddenly…
-It panicked. -…it panicked and leapt into the air.
translation.ko: - 쥐가 발작했다 - 쥐가 발작하며 몸을 날렸다

translation.en: The string pulled it up with a jerk that must've nearly dislocated its leg.
translation.ko: 줄이 확 당겨지면서 다리가 탈골 직전까지 갔다

translation.en: It crouched again at the edge,
translation.ko: 쥐는 줄이 닿는 한 최대한 멀리 주유기 끝으로 기어갔다

translation.en: as far away as the string would allow, whiskers quivering,
translation.ko: 쥐는 줄이 닿는 한 최대한 멀리 주유기 끝으로 기어갔다 수염이 떨리고 긴 회색 몸뚱이는 두려움에 굳었다

translation.en: the long gray body rigid with fear.
translation.ko: 수염이 떨리고 긴 회색 몸뚱이는 두려움에 굳었다

translation.en: At this point, the rat man again began to move his face very slowly,
translation.ko: 그러자 사내는 아주 천천히 상체를 움직여

translation.en: closer and closer.
I wanted to cry out for him to stop, but I couldn't speak.
translation.ko: 그만하라고 외치고 싶었지만 말이 나오지 않았다

translation.en: Something extremely unpleasant was about to happen, I was sure of that.
translation.ko: 몹시 불쾌한 일이 벌어질 것을 확신할 수 있었다

translation.en: Something sinister and cruel, but I had to see it now.
translation.ko: 악랄하고 잔인한 광경을 봐야만 하는 것이다

translation.en: Not more than the length of a man's hand was separating the two.
translation.ko: 두 얼굴 사이의 거리가 한 뼘 정도로 좁혀졌다

translation.en: The rat pressed its body flat, tense and terrified.
translation.ko: 잔뜩 겁먹고 긴장한 쥐는 바닥에 납작 엎드렸다

translation.en: The rat man was also tense,
but with a dangerous active tensity that was like a tight-wound spring.
translation.ko: 잔뜩 당겨 놓은 용수철처럼 위험하고 적극적인 긴장감이었다

translation.en: The shadow of a smile flickered around the skin of his mouth.
Then, suddenly, he struck,
as a snake strikes,
darting his head forward with a swift knife-like stroke…
translation.ko: 칼을 날리듯 빠르게 머리가 앞으로 튀어 나갔다

translation.en: …that originated in the muscles of the lower body…
[editor] …and I had a glimpse of the mouth opening wide…
translation.ko: 언뜻 입을 크게 벌리는 게 보였고

translation.en: …two yellow teeth…
[both] …the whole face contorted by the effort of mouth-opening.
More than that, I did not care to see.
I closed my eyes, and when I opened them again,
translation.ko: 그래서 눈을 감았는데 다시 눈을 떴을 땐

translation.en: the rat was dead,
the rat man was slipping the money into his pocket
and spitting to clear his mouth.
And that's what they makes licorice out of.
Rat's blood's what the big factories and chocolate-makers use to make licorice.
translation.ko: 큰 공장이나 초콜릿 회사에선 쥐 피로 달큰한 맛을 만들죠

translation.en: Nothin' wrong with a drop of rat's blood.
translation.ko: 쥐 피 좀 먹는다고 안 죽어요

translation.en: You are absolutely disgusting.
But that's it, you see. You eaten it many a time.
translation.ko: 사실입니다 두 분도 많이 먹었을 거예요

translation.en: Penny sticks and licorice bootlaces all made from rat's blood.
translation.ko: 막대 초콜릿, 신발 끈 모양 사탕 전부 쥐 피로 만들어요

translation.en: We don't want to hear another word, thanks.
Boiled up in great cauldrons, bubblin' and steamin'
and men stirrin' it with long poles.
One of the big secrets of the chocolate factories,
and no one knows about it, except the ratters supplyin' the stuff.
translation.ko: 피를 공급하는 쥐잡이 외엔 아는 사람이 없어요

translation.en: Suddenly he noticed his audience was no longer with him.
Our faces were hostile and sick-looking and crimson with anger.
translation.ko: 역겨움 가득한 우리의 얼굴은 분노로 시뻘게져 있었다

translation.en: He stopped and turned away without another word.
We watched as he sloped onto the road with a slow, delicate, ambling walk.
translation.ko: 우리는 천천히 조심스럽게 조용히 걸어가는 모습을 바라봤다

translation.en: His footsteps didn't make a sound, not even on the gravel.
translation.ko: 자갈을 밟는데도 발소리 하나 나지 않았다

translation.en: Strange.
The rats never ate the poisoned oats.
translation.ko: 쥐들이 약에 적신 귀리를 안 먹었다니

translation.en: There must be something nutritious in the hayrick.
translation.ko: 건초더미 안에 뭔가 영양가 높은 게 있나 보네요
